title: KNOWLEDGE OF PRIOR THEFT
sample_text:
4.9 
For the purposes of this policy and the exclusions contained in Section 2.2(B), 
 
knowledge possessed by the Insured means knowledge possessed by a  
 
partner, director or an elected or appointed officer who is aware of the  
 
employment of a person and that person's prior acts of Theft, fraud or  
 
dishonesty.
 
At the sole discretion of the Company, coverage may be extended to any  
 
individual upon written application by the Insured and consent given by the 
 
Company.

title: DEDUCTIBLE - NO SUPERSEDED INSURANCE CARRIER INVOLVED
sample_text:
4.3 
From each loss sustained or discovered by the Insured after deducting all  
 
recoveries (except insurance or sureties held by the Insured or the Company 
 
for their benefit) on account thereof made prior to payment shall be deducted 
 
the amount(s) specified in Item 3 of the Schedule. No deductible shall apply to 
 
loss sustained or discovered by any Employee Benefit Plans unless a  
 
deductible amount is specified for such Plans in Item 3 of the Schedule.

title: DEDUCTIBLE - SUPERSEDED INSURANCE CARRIER INVOLVED
sample_text:
4.4 
Should any loss be discovered which is partly recoverable under this policy  
 
and partly recoverable under a prior bond or policy containing a deductible  
 
amount, the deductible amount specified in Item 3 of the Schedule shall be  
 
reduced by the deductible amount applied to such loss by the superseded  
 
insurance carrier.
